P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsEnergyAnalysisEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not energy analysis is enabled, and enable or disable it.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.VersionBuild Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Returns the internal build number of the Autodesk Revit application.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This property can be used by your application to find the version of Autodesk Revit against which your application is running. Based on this information your application can report if it is able to work correctly with that version of Autodesk Revit.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ShortCurveTolerance Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The enforced minimum length for any curve created by Revit.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentReloadingLatest Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentReloadingLatestEventArgs event to be notified when Revit is just about to reload latest changes from a central model.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to reload latest changes from a central model. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read - only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another DocumentReloadingLatest event will be raised immediately after document synchronizing with central model is finished.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ElementTypeDuplicated Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ElementTypeDuplicated event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished duplicating an element type.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished duplicating an element type. It is raised even when duplicating an element type failed or was cancelled (during ElementTypeDuplicating event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in the event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of duplicating an element type has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ActiveAddInId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Retrieves the Id of the currently running external application.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The application can be either a UI application, DB application, or an external command. If no addin is active, this property will return . If an event handler is currently being executed, the returned value will be the Id of the application or command in which the event handler was registered.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentPrinted Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentPrinted event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished printing a view or ViewSet of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished printing a view or ViewSet of the document. It is raised even when document printing failed or was cancelled (during DocumentPriting event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of printing has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.ViewPrinted Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the ViewPrinted event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished printing a view of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished printing a view of the document. If multiple views are combined to a single file, this event will be raised only once. It is raised even when view printing failed. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of view printing has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ViewExporting Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ViewExporting event to be notified when Revit is just about to export a view of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to export a view of the document. It is raised only during accelerated export jobs, in which views are exported in parallel using a background process. Accelerated export only occurs when exporting to DWF formats and not combining views into a single file. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is not cancellable. The 'Cancellable' property of event's argument is always False.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Export()Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Print()Print and similar overloads.SubmitPrint and similar overloads.Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event ViewExported will be raised immediately after view exporting is finished.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ViewExported Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ViewExported event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished exporting a view of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished exporting a view of the document. It is raised only during accelerated export jobs, in which views are exported in parallel using a background process. Accelerated export only occurs when exporting to DWF formats and not combining views into a single file.It is raised even when view exporting failed. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of view exporting has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsMechanicalEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not the mechanical discipline is enabled, and enable or disable it.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsSystemsEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not any systems disciplines (mechanical, electrical, or piping) are enabled.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.VersionName Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Returns the name of the Revit application.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This property can be used by your application to find the version of Revit against which your application is running. Based on this information your application can report if it is able to work correctly with that version of Revit.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsValidThickness Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks if the input value is valid to be supplied as a thickness (for an extrusion, or blend, or wall layer, or similar geometric construct).
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This checks two conditions: The value is greater than or equal to the minimum thickness allowed in Revit for these types of geometric constructs. The value is less than or equal to the maximum length/distance allowed by Revit for elements.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.Dispose Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Releases all resources used by the Application

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.Create Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Provides an object that can be used to create new instances of Autodesk Revit API objects.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The Create property returns an object that is used to create application wide utility and geometric objects within the Autodesk Revit API, such as arrays, sets, lines. This object should be used when you wish to create an object within the Autodesk Revit application memory, rather than your own application's memory. If you are performing your own memory management techniques then it is advisable to create any utility objects via the Create object. For example: Instead of Dim set As New Autodesk_Revit_ElementSet do Set set = application.Create.NewElementSet()

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.GetWorksharingCentralGUID Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Gets the worksharing central GUID of the given server-based model.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The given server-based model saved in a release prior to Revit 2013 did not have this GUID. Only the given server-based model saved in Revit 2013 or later will be able to provide this value.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.AngleTolerance Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Angle tolerance.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Value is in radians. Two angle measurements closer than this value are considered identical. Do not use this value for any purpose other than its intended purpose, which is to check if two angles are the same within this tolerance value. Do not use this value to set the value of an angle. Doing so will result in unstable behavior.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.OpenDocumentFile(String) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Opens a document from disk.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This method opens the document into memory but does not make it visible to the user in any way.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.NewProjectTemplateDocument Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: New project template document
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This command corresponds to New->Project->Project Template command in the user-interface.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.FileImporting Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the FileImporting event to be notified when Revit is just about to import a file of format supported by the API.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to import a file of format supported by the API. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Import()Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another FileImported event will be raised immediately after file importing is finished.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsArchitectureEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not the architecture discipline is enabled, and enable or disable it.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.CurrentUserAddinsLocation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The folder location for .addin files for the current user.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsRouteAnalysisEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not route analysis is enabled, and enable or disable it.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ShowGraphicalWarningElectricalDisconnects Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Whether or not to show the graphical warnings for Electrical disconnects.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ViewsExportingByContext Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ViewsExportingByContext event to be notified when Revit is just about to export one or more views of the document via an export context by CustomExporter.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to export views of the document via an export context by CustomExporter. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event ViewsExportedByContext will be raised immediately after view exporting by CustomExporter is finished.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.ApplicationInitialized Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to this event to get notified after the Revit application has been initialized.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: The event is raised after Revit was launched as fully initialized, including initialization of external applications. The event is not cancellable; the 'Cancellable' property of the event's argument is always False.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.SystemsAnalysisWorkfilesRootPath Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Root path for systems analysis workfiles

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ExtractPartAtomFromFamilyFile Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Writes a PartAtom XML from the contents of a family file.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: If there is a TXT type catalog next to the family file (a TXT file with the same name as the RFA file), the function will read it as well and process its contents into PartAtom. To extract a PartAtom XML from a family loaded into a document in session, use Family.ExtractPartAtom().

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentSynchronizingWithCentral Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSynchronizingWithCentral event to be notified when Revit is just about to synchronize a document with central model.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to synchronize a document with central model. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another DocumentSynchronizedWithCentral event will be raised immediately after document synchronizing with central model is finished.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.UpdateRenderAppearanceLibrary Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Updates the stored render appearance library, giving the Revit session access to any new RPC content.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.Username Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Gets the user name for the current Revit session.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.Language Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The language used in the current session of Revit.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Use this property to determine the language used by Revit; this can allow your application to load the appropriate resources.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentPrinted Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentPrinted event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished printing a view or ViewSet of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished printing a view or ViewSet of the document. It is raised even when document printing failed or was cancelled (during DocumentPriting event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of printing has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentClosing Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentClosing event to be notified when Revit is just about to close a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to close a document.This event is cancellable, except when it is raised during close of the application. Check the 'Cancellable' property of event's argument to see whether it is cancellable or not. When it is cancellable, set the 'Cancel' property in event's argument to True to cancel it. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The document may not be modified during this event.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another DocumentClosed event will be raised immediately after document is closed.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsPipingAnalysisEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not piping analysis is enabled, and enable or disable it.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Enabling piping analysis will not take effect unless the piping discipline is also enabled.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.VersionNumber Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Return the primary version of the Revit application.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This property can be used by your application to find the version of Revit against which your application is running. Based on this information your application can report if it is able to work correctly with that version of Revit.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentSavingAs Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSavingAs event to be notified when Revit is just about to save the document with a new file name.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to save the document with a new file name. Note that the first save of a newly created document will raise DocumentSavingAs rather than DocumentSaving event. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. This event is cancellable, except when it is raised during close of the application. Check the 'Cancellable' property of event's argument to see whether it is cancellable or not. When it is cancellable, call the 'Cancel()' method of event's argument to cancel it. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event DocumentSavedAs will be raised immediately after the document has been saved with a new file name.

T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc:
Represents the Autodesk Revit Application with no access to documents. It provides options
and other application wide data and settings for external applications OnStartup/OnShutdown.

is false, otherwise it should be true.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentSynchronizingWithCentral Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSynchronizingWithCentral event to be notified when Revit is just about to synchronize a document with central model.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to synchronize a document with central model. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another DocumentSynchronizedWithCentral event will be raised immediately after document synchronizing with central model is finished.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsElectricalAnalysisEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not electrical analysis is enabled, and enable or disable it.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Enabling electrical analysis will not take effect unless the electrical discipline is also enabled.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.FailuresProcessing Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the FailuresProcessing event to be notified when failures are being processed at the end of transaction.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when failures are being processed during transaction commit or rollback operations. Handlers of this event have a limited ability to modify the document and/or failures in it, using provided restricted failures accessor interface.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.CurrentUsersDataFolderPath Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Path to data folder for the current user.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Similar to C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Roaming\Autodesk\[ProductType]\[ReleaseName]

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.GetSystemsAnalysisWorkflowNames Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Returns names for systems analysis workflows.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The array that is returned contains the name of the systems analysis workflow, in the order they are specified in Options.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentSaved Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSaved event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished saving a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished saving a document. Note that the first save of a newly created document will raise DocumentSavedAs rather than the DocumentSaved event. It is raised even when document saving failed or was cancelled (during DocumentSaving event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.FailuresProcessing Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the FailuresProcessing event to be notified when failures are being processed at the end of transaction.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when failures are being processed during transaction commit or rollback operations. Handlers of this event have a limited ability to modify the document and/or failures in it, using the provided restricted failures accessor interface. The event arguments provide access to the FailuresAccessor via [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::FailuresProcessingEventArgs::GetFailuresAccessor()] which contains the details of the errors and/or warnings that caused the event to trigger. The arguments also allow you to set a processing result via [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::FailuresProcessingEventArgs::SetProcessingResult()]. The processing result determines if Revit will attempt to recommit the currently failing transaction, roll it back, or continue. If you are explicitly dismissing warnings from the event callback, a processing result of Continue is sufficient. But if you are explicitly resolving errors from the event callback, you must change the processing result to ProceedWithCommit to ensure that the user is not shown the dismissed errors. If you wish to cancel the transaction silently without showing the errors to the user, set the processing result to ProceedWithRollback, however you must also call SetClearAfterRollback(Boolean) in order to dismiss the errors and silently cancel the transaction.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentSaving Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSaving event to be notified when Revit is just about to save a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to save the document. Note that the first save of a newly created document will raise DocumentSavingAs rather than the DocumentSaving event. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. This event is cancellable, except when it is raised during close of the application. Check the 'Cancellable' property of event's argument to see whether it is cancellable or not. When it is cancellable, call the 'Cancel()' method of event's argument to cancel it. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event DocumentSaved will be raised immediately after the document has been saved.

If you want to handle only specific failures but not all types of failures in your application, subscribe to the FailuresProcessing event instead, or use FailuresPreprocessor interface for the specific transaction.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished opening a document. It is raised even when document opening failed or was cancelled (during DocumentOpening event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of opening document has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Pro.title: ProductType Enumeration
T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Pro.desc: An enumerated type containing the possible Revit product types.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentReloadedLatest Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentReloadedLatestEventArgs event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished reloading a document with central model.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished reloading latest changes from a central model. It is raised even when document reloading latest changes from a central model failed or was cancelled (during DocumentReloadingLatest event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of reloading latest changes from a central model has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ViewsExportedByContext Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ViewsExportedByContext event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished exporting one or more views of the document via an export context by CustomExporter.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished exporting views of the document via an export context by CustomExporter.It is raised even when view exporting via export context by CustomExporter failed. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of view exporting by CustomExporter has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.OpenIFCDocument(String, IFCImportOptions) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Opens an IFC document from disk using custom options.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentPrinting Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentPrinting event to be notified when Revit is just about to print a view or ViewSet of the document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to print a view or ViewSet of the document. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method of event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Export()Autodesk::Revit::DB::Document::PrintPrint and similar overloads.SubmitPrint and similar overloads.Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.After this event, for each view being printed, ViewPrinting and ViewPrinted events will be raised. Another event DocumentPrinted will be raised immediately after document printing is finished.

This event is not cancellable, for the process of document creation has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The minimum thickness allowed in Revit for a variety of geometric constructs. These include blends, extrusions, and wall layers.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Do not use this value for any purpose other than its intended purpose. If you want to check for valid thickness value, use the function isValidThickness.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.LoginUserId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc:
The user id of the user currently logged in. The user id will be empty
   if the user is not logged in.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The internal id of Autodesk ID that the current user has logged in to A360. This user id is in human unrecognizable form. In conjunction with the Store Entitlement REST API, a publisher of Autodesk Exchange Store app can verify if the current user has purchased their app from the store. For more information about Store Entitlement API, please refer to www.autodesk.com/developapps.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.WorksharedOperationProgressChanged Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the WorksharedOperationProgressChanged to be notified when progress has changed during Collaboration for Revit's workshared operations: open model and synchronize with central.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is only supported for Collaboration for Revit and will not be raised for those operations occurring in local-worksharing and Revit Server workflow. Users may not change the document in the handler for this event. It is NOT recommended to do any time-consuming work when handling WorksharedOperationProgressChanged event. This can increase workshared operation time." Exception ModificationForbiddenException will be thrown if any document-modifying method is called during this event's handler.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.WorksharedOperationProgressChanged Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: # Subscribe to the WorksharedOperationProgressChanged to be notified when progress has changed during Collaboration for Revit's workshared operations: open model and synchronize with central.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is only supported for Collaboration for Revit and will not be raised for those operations occurring in local-worksharing and Revit Server workflow. Users may not change the document in the handler for this event. If you do not need detailed progress information for synchronizing with central, see [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Events::DocumentSynchronizingWithCentral] or [!:Autodesk::Revit::DB::Events::DocumentSynchronizedWithCentral]. It is NOT recommended to do any time-consuming work when handling DocumentSynchronizingWithCentralProgessChanged event. This can increase workshared operation time." Exception ModificationForbiddenException will be thrown if any document-modifying method is called during this event's handler.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised whenever a Revit transaction is either committed, undone or redone. This is a readonly event, designed to allow you to keep external data in synch with the state of the Revit database. To update the Revit database in response to changes in elements, use the IUpdater framework.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: SubVersionNumber of Revit may have additional APIs and functionality not available in the standard customer releases. Add-ins written to support standard Revit releases should be compatible with SubVersionNumber releases, but add-ins written specifically targeting new features in SubVersionNumber releases would not be compatible with the standard releases.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to save the document. Note that the first save of a newly created document will raise DocumentSavingAs rather than the DocumentSaving event. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. This event is cancellable, except when it is raised during close of the application. Check the 'Cancellable' property of event's argument to see whether it is cancellable or not. When it is cancellable, call the 'Cancel()' method of event's argument to cancel it. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event DocumentSaved will be raised immediately after the document has been saved.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentClosed Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentClosing event to be notified when Revit is just about to close a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished closing a document. It is raised even when document closing failed or was cancelled (during DocumentClosing event).This event is not cancellable, for the process of closing document has already been finished.The document cannot be modified because the corresponding object does not exist anymore.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.FileExported Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the FileExported event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished exporting files of formats supported by the API.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished exporting files of formats supported by the API. It is raised even when file exporting failed or was cancelled (during FileExporting event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not. If export is a part of Publish to Buzzsaw' command which consists of two parts  export of a document followed by publishing it to a BuzzSaw server, the event status only reflects the result of the Export action. The publishing part of the command could still be cancelled or could fail after FileExported event is raised.This event is not cancellable, for the process of exporting file has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.RecordingJournalFilename Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Retrieve the name of the journal file that Revit is currently recording to.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: As Revit operates it keeps a log of operations that the user performs within a file, known as a journal file. These files are useful for providing information about the actions performed in a session and the state of Revit when a problem occurs. These files are included during error reporting to Autodesk.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.SharedComponentsLocation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Location of shared components used by Revit.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.NewProjectDocument(UnitSystem) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Creates a new project document with no template file specified.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.CurrentRevitServerAccelerator Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Current Revit Server accelerator.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Revit connects with Revit Server hosts via current Revit Server accelerator. If current Revit Server accelerator is not set, this will be an empty string.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentOpened Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentOpened event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished opening a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished opening a document. It is raised even when document opening failed or was cancelled (during DocumentOpening event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of opening document has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Location of shared components used by Revit.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentSaved Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentSaved event to be notified immediately after Revit has finished saving a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished saving a document. Note that the first save of a newly created document will raise DocumentSavedAs rather than the DocumentSaved event. It is raised even when document saving failed or was cancelled (during DocumentSaving event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' property in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of saving document has already been finished.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.NewFamilyDocument Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: New family document, including family, titleblock, and annotation symbol

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.GetFailureDefinitionRegistry Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Returns the instance of FailureDefinitionRegistry.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.SubVersionNumber Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The minor version number of Revit
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: SubVersionNumber of Revit may have additional APIs and functionality not available in the standard customer releases. Add-ins written to support standard Revit releases should be compatible with SubVersionNumber releases, but add-ins written specifically targeting new features in SubVersionNumber releases would not be compatible with the standard releases.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsLoggedIn Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks if the user is logged in from this session to their Autodesk account.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.FileExporting Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the FileExporting event to be notified when Revit is just about to export files of formats supported by the API.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to export files of formats supported by the API. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Export()Autodesk.Revit.Document.Print()Print and similar overloads.SubmitPrint and similar overloads.Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another FileExported event will be raised immediately after file exporting is finished.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.GetLibraryPaths Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Returns path information identifying where Revit searches for content.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: The map that is returned contains a key that is purpose of the path, such as Material Libraries and the value in the map is the fully qualified path that is used for that search path.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.BackgroundColor Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The background color to use for model views in this session.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.FamilyLoadedIntoDocument Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the FamilyLoadedInto event to be notified after Revit loaded a family into a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised immediately after Revit has finished loading a family into a document. It is raised even when family loading failed or was cancelled (during FamilyLoadingIntoDocument event). Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Check the 'Status' field in event's argument to see whether the action itself was successful or not.This event is not cancellable, for the process of importing has already been finished.If the action was not successful, the document may not be modified and new transactions may not be started.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentOpening Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentOpening event to be notified when Revit is just about to open a document.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to open a document.Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The document cannot be modified, for it is not opened yet at the time of the event.Another DocumentOpened event will be raised immediately after document is opened.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ProgressChanged Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the ProgressChanged event to be notified when an operation in Revit has progress bar data available.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Handlers of this event may use the Cancel method to cancel the operation tracked by the progress bar. Users may not change the document in the handler for this event. Exception ModificationForbiddenException will be thrown if any document-modifying method is called during this event's handler.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.FamilyLoadingIntoDocument Event

Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Import()Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another FamilyLoadedIntoDocument event will be raised immediately after family loading is finished.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.GetSystemsAnalysisWorkflows Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Returns name and path information identifying systems analysis workflow files.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The map that is returned contains a key that is the name of the systems analysis workflow, and the value is the path to the workflow file.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsStructuralAnalysisEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not the structural analysis is enabled, and enable or disable it.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: When structural analysis is disabled the structural analytical model will not be updated automatically by Revit. Enabling structural analysis will not take effect unless the structure discipline is also enabled.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.SharedParametersFilename Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Contains the fully qualified path to a shared parameters file.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This path can be read and set via this property. By default Autodesk Revit does not have a shared parameters file so this property must be set before access is made to the shared parameters file object otherwise an exception will be thrown.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DocumentClosed Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the DocumentClosing event to be notified when Revit is just about to close a document.

It is raised even when document closing failed or was cancelled (during DocumentClosing event).This event is not cancellable, for the process of closing document has already been finished.The document cannot be modified because the corresponding object does not exist anymore.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.IsLateAddinLoading Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc:
Indicates whether this add-in is loaded on the fly or not. If it is loaded when is Revit starting up, it
is false, otherwise it should be true.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.PointCloudsRootPath Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Root path for point cloud files.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to duplicate an element type.Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Import()Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another ElementTypeDuplicated event will be raised immediately after duplicating an element type is finished.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.DefaultViewDiscipline Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: The view discipline that will be applied to new views by default.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This view discipline may be overridden by a view template when a view template is also applied to new views.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.IsJournalPlaying Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Determines if the application is currently in journal playback mode.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: Determines if Revit is in the process of playing back a journal. It can be used to help prevent any user interaction that may cause issues during playback. For more information on Revit's journaling features contact the Autodesk Developer Network.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.OpenDocumentFile(ModelPath, OpenOptions, IOpenFromCloudCallback) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Opens a document from disk or cloud.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This method opens the document into memory but does not make it visible to the user in any way. If the user currently has ownership of elements in this model and there is no local model on this machine, Revit will post a warning.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.PurgeReleasedAPIObjects Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Explicitly purges all API objects that have been released but are still awaiting to be finalized
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Revit purges API objects automatically every time when command control returns from an API application (an external command, event handler, etc.) back to Revit. This is necessary because Revit does not allow API objects to be finalized when the finalization is invoked from an outside thread (from the garbage collector, specifically). This automatic purging is adequate in most scenarios. When an application uses a lot of API objects during one single command though, it may be necessary or beneficial to invoke an additional purge explicitly to free the deleted API objects from memory.

T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Lan.title: LanguageType Enumeration
T:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Lan.desc: An enumerated type containing the supported Revit product languages.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.IsInfrastructureEnabled Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Checks whether or not infrastructure discipline is enabled, and enable or disable it.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.OpenSharedParameterFile Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Enables access to shared parameter groups and definitions that are maintained on disk.
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This function is used to return an object that represents a Revit shared parameters file Revit can use only one shared parameters file at one time. The filename for the shared parameters file can be set in the Application.SharedParametersFilename property.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ShowGraphicalWarningDuctDisconnects Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Whether or not to show the graphical warnings for duct disconnects.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.CurrentUsersAddinsDataFolderPath Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Path to AddinsData folder for the current user.
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: Similar to C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Roaming\Autodesk\[ProductType]\[ReleaseName]\AddinsData

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentSavingAs Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc:
Subscribe to the DocumentSavingAs event to be notified when Revit is just about to save the document with a new file name.
   This event is raised when Revit is just about to save the document with a new file name.
   Note that the first save of a newly created document  will raise DocumentSavingAs rather than DocumentSaving event.
   
   Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document),
   except for documents that are currently in read-only mode.
   This event is cancellable, except when it is raised during close of the application.
   Check the 'Cancellable' property of event's argument to see whether it is cancellable or not.
   When it is cancellable, call the 'Cancel()' method of event's argument to cancel it.
   Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event:
   Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another event DocumentSavedAs will be raised immediately after the document has been saved with a new file name.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.ProgressChanged Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the ProgressChanged event to be notified when an operation in Revit has progress bar data available.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: Handlers of this event may use the Cancel method to cancel the operation tracked by the progress bar. Users may not change the document in the handler for this event. Exception ModificationForbiddenException will be thrown if any document-modifying method is called during this event's handler.

Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another DocumentReloadingLatest event will be raised immediately after latest changes reloading from a central model is finished.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ApplicationInitialized Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to this event to get notified after the Revit application has been initialized
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: The event is raised after Revit was launched as fully initialized, including initialization of external applications.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.ImportIFCCategoryTable Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Full path to the file that defines IFC entity to Revit category mappings for IFC import.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.DocumentChanged Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Subscribe to the FailuresProcessingEvent event to be notified when Revit document has changed.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.remarks: This event is raised whenever a Revit transaction is either committed, or undone or redone. This is a read-only event, designed to allow you to keep external data in sync with the state of the Revit database. To update the Revit database in response to changes in elements, use the IUpdater framework.

P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.title: ControlledApplication.CurrentUsersAddinsDataFolderPath Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.Con.desc: Path to AddinsData folder for the current user.

M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.RegisterFailuresProcessor Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: If there is previously registered Failures Processor, it gets discarded. If you opt to register a FailuresProcessor for Revit, your processor will become the default error handler for all Revit errors for the session. The standard Revit error dialog will not appear.

E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.title: Application.FileExporting Event
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.desc: Subscribe to the FileExporting event to be notified when Revit is just about to export files of formats supported by the API.
E:Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.App.remarks: This event is raised when Revit is just about to export files of formats supported by the API. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for documents that are currently in read-only mode. Event is cancellable. To cancel it, call the 'Cancel()' method in event's argument to True. Your application is responsible for providing feedback to the user about the reason for the cancellation.The following API functions are not available for the current document during this event: All overloads of Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document.Export()Autodesk.Revit.Document.Print()Print and similar overloads.SubmitPrint and similar overloads.Close and similar overloads.Save .SaveAs(String) and similar overloads.Exception InvalidOperationException will be thrown if any of the above methods is called during this event.Another FileExported event will be raised immediately after file exporting is finished.
